body_html:
Sorry to hijack your thread @Gad1001

I compiled and ran this tool to check for AVX support and it shows my CPU does not, also confirmed at cpu boss I'm running on a VM in hyper-V on a xeon W3670.

I just read the releases page mentioning AVX starting with 1.6. I was running tensorflow 1.5 before so this makes sense!
body_text:
Sorry to hijack your thread @Gad1001
I compiled and ran this tool to check for AVX support and it shows my CPU does not, also confirmed at cpu boss   I'm running on a VM in hyper-V on a xeon W3670.
I just read the releases page mentioning AVX starting with 1.6.   I was running tensorflow 1.5 before so this makes sense!
body:
Sorry to hijack your thread @Gad1001

I compiled and ran [this tool](https://gist.github.com/hi2p-perim/7855506#file-ssecheck-cpp) to check for AVX support and it shows my CPU does not, also confirmed at [cpu boss](http://cpuboss.com/cpu/Intel-Xeon-W3670)   I'm running on a VM in hyper-V on a xeon W3670. 

I just read the releases page mentioning AVX starting with 1.6.   I was running tensorflow 1.5 before so this makes sense!
